page.title: 15Fishing Around Rhenigidale
page.content: Included in this block are some areas of sea. {Loch Seaforth}and {Loch {Trollamarig}are extensively used by the{Scalpay, Harris }fishing boats. They fish for prawns, clams and lobsters in the more sheltered waters and for white fish elsewhere. The fishing boat that usually brings in our supplies{The M.V. Girl Morag,}sets creels to catch prawns in the area around the village. Small fish called{ {'cuddies'}can be caught in the bay at Rhenigidale using a fishing rod and a line and it is also possible to go out in a small boat and use lines with feathers to catch mackerel and smaller white fish around the shore line and the reefs. Some of the sheltered areas are being used to cultivate mussels. Ropes are hung onto wooden rafts and mussels grow on the ropes for 2 years until they are big enough to be sold.
